techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.' - Daniel Webster

techs.name: Pottery
techs.quote: 'Shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, what makest thou?' - Bible Isaiah 45:9

techs.name: Animal Husbandry
techs.quote: 'Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.' - Bible Deuteronomy 25:4

techs.name: Archery
techs.quote: 'The haft of the arrow has been feathered with one of the eagle's own plumes, we often give our enemies the means of our own destruction' - Aesop

techs.name: Mining
techs.quote: 'The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.' - J. Paul Getty

techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: 'He who commands the sea has command of everything.' - Themistocles

techs.name: Calendar
techs.quote: 'So teach us to number our days, so that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.' - Bible Psalms 90:12

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: 'He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.' - John Milton

techs.name: Trapping
techs.quote: 'Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall into the same traps or nets twice.' - Saint Jerome

techs.name: The Wheel
techs.quote: 'Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart.' - Japanese proverb

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: 'How happy are those whose walls already rise!' - Virgil

techs.name: Bronze Working
techs.quote: 'Here Hector entered, with a spear eleven cubits long in his hand; the bronze point gleamed in front of him, and was fastened to the shaft of the spear by a ring of gold.' - Homer

techs.name: Optics
techs.quote: 'He made an instrument to know if the moon shine at full or no.' - Samuel Butler

techs.name: Horseback Riding
techs.quote: 'A Horse! A Horse! My kingdom for a horse!' - Shakespeare (Richard III)

techs.name: Mathematics
techs.quote: 'Mathematics is the gate and key to the sciences.' - Roger Bacon

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: 'Three things are to be looked to in a building: that it stands on the right spot; that it be securely founded; that it be successfully executed.' - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

techs.name: Philosophy
techs.quote: 'There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.' - Socrates

techs.name: Drama and Poetry
techs.quote: 'What is drama but life with the dull bits cut out.' - Alfred Hitchcock

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: 'Better is bread with a happy heart than wealth with vexation.' - Amenemope

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: 'Instrumental or mechanical science is the noblest and, above all others, the most useful.' - Leonardo da Vinci

techs.name: Iron Working
techs.quote: 'Do not wait to strike til the iron is hot, but make it hot by striking.' - William Butler Yeats

techs.name: Theology
techs.quote: 'Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do' - St. Thomas Aquinas

techs.name: Civil Service
techs.quote: 'The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is its inefficiency' - Eugene McCarthy

techs.name: Guilds
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Gold]
techs.quote: 'The merchants and the traders have come; their profits are pre-ordained...' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Metal Casting
techs.quote: 'When pieces of bronze or gold or iron break, the metal-smith welds them together again in the fire, and the bond is established.' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib
